title: Unable to Login through VS2019 Bitbucket extension to local Bitbucket server accepting only https
body:
- Using Visual Studio 2019
-  a self-hosted version of Bitbucket Server (ver Atlassian Bitbucket v6.10.0)  secured with self-signed SSL certificate
-  Server hosted in local Enterprise environment that uses a proxy

When attempting to connect to the Bitbucket server via the extension in VS2019, I receive this error:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11597954/73290408-01ee2080-41c4-11ea-869a-be47f055d279.png)

title: Visual Studio 2019 Sync Errors

title: BitBucket access permission only Admin
body: Not sure if it's a bug or by design. We would like to use the ext however from BitBucket it's only allowed to be used from users that are set as repository admin. Users that are listed as Write (which almost have the same permission) doesn't work.

title: Filter Pull requests by reviewer
body: In Team Explorer > Pull Requests, there seems to be no way of seeing only the pull requests where I am either the reviewer or the author. This would be great when you work in a larger team with multiple reviewers.

title: Empty login screen in VS2019
body:
Just setting up a new dev environment, installed VS Community 2019 (v16.2.5), installed ReSharper (Ultimate 2019.2.2), installed GitHub extension (2.9.1.7781) and Bitbucket extension (1.41.2).

I have seen the exception stacktrace as per issue #97.  I didn't do anything specific to fix it, next time I rebooted I could see the Bitbucket extension and login link as expected.  However after clicking Login I'm presented with a blank window:
![Bitbucket login window](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8241300/65105235-9fb43080-da17-11e9-967c-b3b62dc158f8.png)
If I move the mouse cursor around, it changes to indicate that the input fields actually are there, I just can't see them.

Issue still persists after restart VS or reboot.

I checked log file in `%appdata%\GitClientVSExtension\Logs`, this is the contents:

	2019-09-18 12:47:33,354 [1] INFO  GitClientVS.VisualStudio.UI.GitClientVSPackage [(null)] - Initialized GitClientVsPackage Extension
	2019-09-18 13:15:24,362 [1] ERROR GitClientVS.VisualStudio.UI.GitClientVSPackage [(null)] - Unhandled Dispatcher GitClientVsExtensions Error
	System.Exception: The component 'MahApps.Metro.Controls.GlowWindow' does not have a resource identified by the URI '/MahApps.Metro;component/controls/glowwindow.xaml'.
	   at System.Windows.Application.LoadComponent(Object component, Uri resourceLocator)
	   at MahApps.Metro.Controls.GlowWindow.InitializeComponent()
	   at MahApps.Metro.Controls.GlowWindow..ctor(Window owner, GlowDirection direction)
	   at MahApps.Metro.Behaviours.GlowWindowBehavior.AssociatedObjectOnLoaded(Object sender, RoutedEventArgs routedEventArgs)
	   at System.Windows.RoutedEventHandlerInfo.InvokeHandler(Object target, RoutedEventArgs routedEventArgs)
	   at System.Windows.EventRoute.InvokeHandlersImpl(Object source, RoutedEventArgs args, Boolean reRaised)
	   at System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseEventImpl(DependencyObject sender, RoutedEventArgs args)
	   at System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseEvent(RoutedEventArgs e)
	   at System.Windows.BroadcastEventHelper.BroadcastEvent(DependencyObject root, RoutedEvent routedEvent)
	   at System.Windows.BroadcastEventHelper.BroadcastLoadedEvent(Object root)
	   at MS.Internal.LoadedOrUnloadedOperation.DoWork()
	   at System.Windows.Media.MediaContext.FireLoadedPendingCallbacks()
	   at System.Windows.Media.MediaContext.FireInvokeOnRenderCallbacks()
	   at System.Windows.Media.MediaContext.RenderMessageHandlerCore(Object resizedCompositionTarget)
	   at System.Windows.Media.MediaContext.RenderMessageHandler(Object resizedCompositionTarget)
	   at System.Windows.Media.MediaContext.Resize(ICompositionTarget resizedCompositionTarget)
	   at System.Windows.Interop.HwndTarget.OnResize()
	   at System.Windows.Interop.HwndTarget.HandleMessage(WindowMessage msg, IntPtr wparam, IntPtr lparam)
	   at System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource.HwndTargetFilterMessage(IntPtr hwnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wParam, IntPtr lParam, Boolean& handled)
	   at MS.Win32.HwndWrapper.WndProc(IntPtr hwnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wParam, IntPtr lParam, Boolean& handled)
	   at MS.Win32.HwndSubclass.DispatcherCallbackOperation(Object o)
	   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
	   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)

title: Visual Studio 2019 Start Up Prompt has no option for BitBucket.
body:
![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10372299/60071220-fcfd5600-9736-11e9-92e9-5aae4d75cdb3.JPG)
![Capture2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10372299/60071221-fcfd5600-9736-11e9-8016-a7af73d5ce7c.JPG)

As one can observe in the attached images, I do not have an option to directly clone from Bitbucket using my log in credentials. I need to type the Git URL manually, while for Azure there is an option.

```
Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2019
Version 16.1.3
VisualStudio.16.Release/16.1.3+29009.5
Microsoft .NET Framework
Version 4.7.03190

```

title: PR review panel shows old module name
body: Reviewing a PR that has had a module renamed still shows the old name in the review panel Files Changed list. The browser-based stash PR review panel shows the correct file name for the exact same PR. Using Visual Studio 2019 Enterprise and Bitbucket Extension 1.41.2

title: Feature: Select project when creating repo
body: It would be nice to have a dropdown to select an existing project, or create a new project when creating a repository.

title: Bitbucket is not respecting the default files comparer
body:
I'm using Visual studio 2017 professional with beyond compare as a diff/merge tool for our git (bitbucket) source code.

As you can see, BC is invoked I'm trying to compare with history : 

[![enter image description here][1]][1]

I also wanted to see pull requests so I've installed the Bitbucket extension , and now I do see the additional button : 

[![enter image description here][2]][2]

But when I click on the file in order to see the changes : 

[![enter image description here][3]][3]

— Then I see the built-in  diff tool of windows :

[![][4]][4]



**Question:**

How can I overwrite VS's default Diff tool, so that it will invoke Beyond-Compare , instead(!) of this default Diff tool?

  [1]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/OjWYR.png
  [2]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/x5hC0.png
  [3]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/5n7AM.png
  [4]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/gpYn0.png

title: And syntax highlighting and Goto Definition.
body: Reviewing pull requests in Visual Studio is nice so you can do it all in one place, but I think the real advantage of reviewing them in the IDE as apposed to the web would be the ability to utilize VS features like syntax highlighting, goto definition, find all references, and other navigation features provided by the IDE for files.

title: Incorrect highlighting and line numbering
body:
Changes highlighting and line numbering are displayed incorrectly. See screenshot

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/360990/46208904-eefbdf80-c334-11e8-80a2-d27c45b84517.png)

Side-by-side diff displays information correctly
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/360990/46209079-6d588180-c335-11e8-9549-43ad505700d8.png)

I'm using Visual Studio Professional, version is 15.8.5. Bitbucket Extension version is 1.37.95

It seems that unnecessary newline is added after each line.

title: Requesting support for get worktree add
body:
It is my understanding that "git worktree add" is not currently supported by the extension.  Any way this could be added?

Also, it would be nice if somehow a suggested working directory path could be derived from the main repository working directory + branch name, assuming the branch is named resembling a folder structure.

title: Crashes as soon as VS2017 loads up
body:
I followed the steps as in the tutorial, then, after installing the extension, as soon as VS opens up it will display this Exception right where the extension should be displaying BitBucket's extension.

Visual Studio 2017 Community v15.7.5

```
Microsoft.VisualStudio.Composition.CompositionFailedException: An exception was thrown while initializing part "GitClientVS.UI.Views.ConnectSectionView". ---> System.Windows.Markup.XamlParseException: Set property 'GitClientVS.UI.Styles.SharedResourceDictionary.Source' threw an exception. ---> System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Could not load file or assembly 'MahApps.Metro, Culture=neutral' or one of its dependencies. title: Pull Requests are not seen if connected to a Bitbucket server mirror
```
body: I'm using BitBucket Server (not Cloud), and if I use a mirror URL, I do not see Pull Requests option in Team Explorer. If I switch to the primary server, I can see the PRs tab. This happens even if I give different URLs for Push and Fetch. Is this behavior expected?

title: Latest version not compatible with debugging with Visual studio 2017 tools for unity
body:
When the latest version of bitbucket for visual studio is enabled, debugging doesn't work using VS 2017 tools for Unity. When I click on "Attach to Unity" in VS to initiate debugging, after the build has succeeded an error message shows: "The operation couldn't be completed".

When I disable bitbucket for visual studio, everything works again as expected.

This behaviour started after I updated VS 2017 from version 15.5.7 to any later versions including the latest one 15.7.3

title: Pull Request w merge conflict does not launch vsdiffmerge
body:
I am trying to shift my organization to using pull requests.  I have the plugin installed and working to create and show the pull requests.  But the merge is failing even when there are no conflicts in the merge.  If there are no conflicts in the merge, it actually still happens; but I get the same error. 

When I attempt a merge I get an error of:

"Unknown error.  (Unexpected character encountered while parsing value: {, Path '', line1, position 1.). Check logs for more into.  

When I run VS 2017 in admin with logging enabled I do not see anything unusual except two attempts to " Entering function CVsPackageInfo::HrInstantiatePackage" followed by a begin / end package load.  No errors to follow up on.  

Has anyone else seen this issue, I expected it to bring up the VSDiffMerge tool to complete the merge when there is a conflict.   Do I have something setup wrong, or is this an actual bug in the plugin?

Thanks for any advice...

title: Tasks for Pull Request are missing
body: If I have tasks in a PR which have to be solved the Extensions do not shown the task in the Overview and in the detail view

title: Pull Requests for Bitbucket Server ignore default reviewers
body:
Currently the implementation of the `EnterprisePullRequestClient` does not add the default reviewers that are setup in the repository.

The API for fetching the default reviewers is documented here:
https://docs.atlassian.com/bitbucket-server/rest/5.1.1/bitbucket-default-reviewers-rest.html

Unlike the cloud default reviewers the API seems to require the source and the target reference ID as well as the source and target repository ID to get the default reviewers. This lines up with the configuration possible in bitbucket server, as the default reviewers are setup on a branch level.

title: Team Explorer's Push pane displays an error
body:
ver. 1.3.75

Just after launching Visual Studio (any project is not open) I got an error when I pressed the Sync button in Team Explorer.

![bberr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2569664/38245567-7fe32212-3779-11e8-9fa8-6ce160010b1d.png)

title: Add support for Bitbucket OAuth/2FA
body:
Hi

Thanks for writing this it is very impressive (thumbsup).

One thing that stops me using it on a daily basis is that we use 2FA with out Bitbucket accounts, as such we can't login using ust a username/password. 
While it is possible to get around this using app-passwords , https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/app-passwords-828781300.html, the other alternative is to use OAuth. This approach is used by the Git Credential Manager (GCM), https://github.com/Microsoft/Git-Credential-Manager-for-Windows/tree/master/Bitbucket.Authentication/OAuth

This approach is also available in the GitHub extension for Visual Studio.

I'm proposing to re-implement the GCM approach here in the VS extension.

title: Documentation to show steps on how to configure
body:
Some help on the steps to configure the extension with some picturs would be great.

Also, addressing how to setup if the VS env. has previous connections to github & TFS online without collisions would be great.

title: Support BitBucket Branching Model when creating a new branch
body: It would be nice to have a simple dropdown for selecting type of branch to create similar to how the branching model works on the BitBucket website so that user error is avoided.

title: Bitbucket causes Visual Studio 2017 to start slowly.
body:
Visual Studio complains about the add-in causing a delay on startup, probably because it tries to connect or auth as part of loading:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4173387/30481121-49b9e77e-9a1d-11e7-9bac-4b2417d1f1c2.png)

title: Improve error messages from the server
body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4173387/30182874-a245ebd2-9418-11e7-890c-fcd327df1ea0.png)

Fiddler helped me debug the actual issue:

```
Too many invalid password attempts. Try logging in through the website with your password.
```

After a password reset, logging on to the website, and trying again, everything works. A more useful error message would be very, very helpful

title: Pull Request Detail View window should be redesigned
body: Currently it's very hard to navigate in comments due to small space in the window.

title: Window is not scrolled to newly added comment
body: When user modify a comment in inline view scroll should be moved to recently added/edited comment. This feature already works in not inline comments.

title: Bitbucket Server - attachments are not displayed in comments
body: Because Bitbucket Server doesn't respond with an url attachment, it's just displayed without downloading its content. Convert BS url attachment into proper url, download it and display in comment.

title: Bitbucket Server - Add possibility to access through SSH with disabled HTTPS
body:
Have Visual Studio Enterprise 2017 Version 15.2 (26430.16) with Bitbucket Extension V 1.36

Getting error when trying to connect to on prem BitBucket server (see attached screen shot):

Unknown error. (Error mapping types.

Mapping types:
List'1 -> List'1


![screen shot 2017-07-22 at 3 21 13 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30378343/28494942-be173096-6ef2-11e7-8c98-114672171ed9.png)

title: Add word level highlighting for Inline Diff
body:
Currently only side by side diff displays words which were changed.
In inline mode we can see only the line number so it would be good to highlight words which were changed.
